PreviewMobile Services

It supports iOS/Android/WP APP backstage development, and can use personalized services such as push real-time notification in a timely manner, allowing you to easily create Mobile Apps based on Azure.

Apply for a 1RMB Trial Buy Now

Azure Mobile Services provides a expandable cloud rear end for building Windows application store, Windows Phone, Apple iOS, Android, and HTML/JavaScript applications. In just a few minutes, you can save data to the cloud, verify user identity, and send push notifications to applications.

Azure Mobile Services is offered at three levels: free, basic, and standard.

Pricing Details

Migration Notification

To meet the featureal requests made by users for Azure Mobile Services in the past few years, Microsoft Azure project, which is operated by 21Vianet, plans to migrate Azure Mobile Services to Azure App Service. Users can choose to migrate themselves by March 1, 2017, or choose to be assisted by Azure for the migration after March 1, 2017. Azure Mobile Services will be officially closed in June 2017.
The migration will bring changes to pricing and billing methods. The new pricing and billing methods will take effect on January 1, 2017. For detailed pricing and billing methods, please refer to the Azure App Services Pricing Details page.

FAQs

Expand all
  • How to upgrade to a higher level?

    Upgrade is available at any time through the Azure Management Portal. Upgrades will take effect immediately.

  • How to increase storage capacity to the back-end of mobile services?

    For "Basic" and "Standard" levels, you can increase the number of units dedicated to a specific service with the "Scale" tab in the Azure Management Portal. Also, you can increase the storage capacity through upgrading to a higher level.

  • How to distinguish the only active device in the free level of mobile services?

    The active device for a specific mobile service is identified by the installation ID. For physical devices, the installation ID usually remains the same as long as the user does not uninstall the application. For the device simulator, the simulator applied determines whether to provide the same installation ID or a new installation ID each time when the application is launched.
